sentence.Network_en: His misunderstanding of language was the primary cause of his other problems.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对语言的误解是引起其他问题的主要原因。

sentence.Network_en: There must be some misunderstanding—I thought I ordered the smaller model.
sentence.Network_cn: 一定是搞错了—我以为我订的是更小型号的。

sentence.Network_en: He was the unknowing cause of all the misunderstanding.
sentence.Network_cn: 他无意中引起了这一切误会。

entry.def: A misunderstanding is a failure to understand something properly, for example a situation or a person's remarks.

example.ex: There has been some misunderstanding of our publishing aims...
example.tran: 关于我们的出版目的存在着某些误解。

example.ex: Tell your midwife what you want so she can make a note of it and avoid misunderstandings.
example.tran: 把你的要求告诉助产士，这样她可以记下来，避免产生误解。

entry.def: You can refer to a disagreement or slight quarrel as a misunderstanding .

sentences.sentence: "his misinterpretation of the question caused his error"

means.word_mean: 2. an understanding of something that is not correct;

sentences.sentence: "he wasn't going to admit his mistake"
"there must be some misunderstanding--I don't have a sister"

auth_sentence.content: You are also misunderstanding what I mean by healthy.

auth_sentence.content: There may also be some misunderstanding regarding my position.

Sentence.sentence: Learning how different cultures signal respect can help you avoid misunderstandings.
Although these educators may have good intentions,their advice to families is misguided, and it stemsfrom misunderstandings about the process of language acquisition.
Learning how different cultures signal respect can help you avoid misunderstandings.

sentences.en: Clear up misunderstandings between the two nations.
